prior to S phase initiation in eukaryotic ceils (10). This cell cycle phase closely follows
increased LDL binding to cell membranes (11). wt.ich preceeds intraceilular concentration
increases of cholesterol. triglycerides, and phospholipids noted just prior to the initiation
of S phase. These findings support the suggestion by Curtis (12-14) that lipoproteins, speci-

ability to cells appears to represent a mechanism by which DNA polymerase-a activation
might be studied.
GM1915 cells, a diploid human fibroblast ceii jine derived from a female patient with
hypercholesterolemia. is deficient for apolipoprutoin B receptor, exhibits decreased internal.
ization of low density lipoprotein (15), and inefficiently repairs ultraviolet light type (long
patch repair) DNA lesions. To assess the relutiv, differences in uctivity of DNA poly.
merases α and 6 in normal (WI38) and repair deficient (GM1915) human diploid fibroblasts,
cells were treated with varying concentrations of rutagens and incorporation of 3H-Tdr as
a measure of DNA excision repair was determined. !.fethyl methanesulfonate (MMS) initiates
short-patch DNA repair requiring DNA polymerase.  . Both GM1915 and WI38 cells exhibit
DNA polymerase- 3 activity (Figure 1). Equivalent l-vels of 3H.Tdr incorporation into DNA
in the two cell lines (Figure 1) differ from data seen in Figure 2 showing that BPDE.
initiated DNA damage results in significantly more "H·Tdr incorporation in W138 cells than
in GM1915 cells. BPDE, a reactive metabolite of benzolalpyrene, is similar to ultraviolet
light in that it initiates long patch excision repair utilizing DNA polymerase-a for the major
repolymerization of excised nucleotides. The maxinal 3H-Tdr incorporation observed for
GM1915 cells was about '20% of that seeo for WI38 cells, and was initiated by treatment
with BPDE at 100 ng/ml.Since the reduced levelof 3H.Tr incorporation in GM1915 fibro-
blasts might be the result of variations in thymidice pool size, the relative Tdr pools in
w138 and GM1915 cells were examined and found comparable, being 1.06 and 1.0 respec.
tively.
Data shown in Figures 1 and 2 suggest that WI38 and GM1915 colls have active
